headline: U.S. crude oil tops $130 a barrel, a 13-year high on possible Western ban of Russian oil
author: Tanaya Macheel
sentences: U.S. crude oil surged more than 8% in early trading on Sunday evening as the market continued to react to supply disruptions stemming from Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine and the possibility of a ban on Russian oil and natural gas.
West Texas Intermediate crude futures, the U.S. oil benchmark, traded 8% higher to above $125 a barrel, the highest since July 2008.
The international benchmark, Brent crude, traded 9% higher to $128.60, also the highest price seen since 2008.
At one point the price rose to $130.50 Sunday evening before retreating.
Brent hit a high of $139.13 at one point overnight.
